page.title: 01 North-East Wolverhampton
page.content: A mainly residential area that includes 2 sq km of farmland in the north east. Most houses are built in estates which are mainly council owned. They are mostly semi-detached with some low-rise flats and a few terraced or detached property. Much of the housing in the north-west has been recently renovated though a lot of dereliction is still evident.There are many public services and untilites some of which are seriously vandalised! The only central place is the old settlement of Wednesfield. There is some industry, mainly at Fallings Park. There is a lot of open space,some formal parkland or recreational areas. On the council estates there are many small open spaces. A major open area with many footpaths over it is Bushbury Hill. There are many signs of social stress and povery over much of the area.
